page.title: 13Hillsborough Lake
page.content: {The lake at Hillsborough,}or more accurately,{the dam,}is home to many water birds such as; mute swans, mallard, tufted duck, pochard, the coot with it's familiar head movement, the moorhen and the ever-present gull. {The well-worn path around the edge is just over a mile long and offers excellent vantage points for bird-watchers. When the{fishing}is good heron and the great crested grebe are visitors. Whooper swans have been known to shelter on the lake during bad winters. Summer visitors include the swift from Africa. {The calm beauty of the lake}makes it a popular walk for tourists. For many years it was also a popular spot for trout fishing. Surrounding it is a deciduous and coniferous forest, home of the Jay and short-eared owl.
